item.title: Turaj add a quote by Pearl S. Buck
item.description: "Many people lose the small joys in the hope for the big happiness." -- Pearl S. Buck

item.title: Turaj add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Turaj add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Turaj add a quote by Anatole France
item.description: "All changes, even the most longed for, have their melancholy; for what we leave behind us is a part of ourselves; we must die to one life before we can enter another." -- Anatole France

item.title: Turaj add a quote by Anatole France
item.description: "To accomplish great things, we must not only act but also dream, not only plan, but also believe!" -- Anatole France

item.title: Turaj add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Turaj add a quote by Herman Hesse
item.description: "When someone seeks," said Siddhartha, "then it easily happens that his eyes see only the thing that he seeks, and he is able to find nothing, to take in nothing because he always thinks only about the thing he is seeking, because he has one goal, because he is obsessed with his goal. Seeking means: having a goal. But finding means: being free, being open, having no goal." -- Herman Hesse

item.title: Turaj add a quote by Marguerite Duras
item.description: "Very early in my life it was too late." -- Marguerite Duras

item.title: Turaj add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "Estragon: Nothing to be done." -- Samuel Beckett
